It's final. On March 7th, I move and that room is MINE, ALL MINE. ::hops up and down::

That's ... wow, only a month from now. YEAH! HELL YEAH! ... February 7th, wow, again -- I hadn't even made the connection. I knew the date was familiar for one reason or another but it just dawned on me

so!

happy one year, Brian!

On another note, don't ... expect posts like ... ever in here ... because I just don't care.

Oh my god. Just ... oh my god.

::head explodes::

Thank you (whoeverthefuckyouare) for everything. Thankyouthankyouthankyoputahnkyourakgjhrtoiasuldaskd...

For delayed flights that lead to canceled flights that lead to disappointment that lead to free plane tickets that lead to further appreciation of return that lead to ... freevacationforme because my boyfriend wants to use his free plane ticket to take me somewhere in March.

::head explodes::

For my grandmother moving in that leads to an annoyed mother that leads to more frequent conversation that leads to a new bonding with both -mothers that leads to a new understanding of my life that leads to ... afarmorematureandnaturalrelationship because they finally get that I can do this on my own.

::head explodes::

For friends that experience what I do simultaneously, that strive to understand, that don't condemn but rather explore every facet of a situation and choose to learn right along with me.

For 

every

thing

Aden's

vomit

Because even that let me leave a silly note on Josh's door that produced laughter.

I can work six days a week, a minimum of six hours a day (and that's a lazy day at Outback), pay bills out the wazoo, have money to spare, clamp down on my whims and manage said money fairly responsibly, spend nearly every night with my boyfriend after spending our days in separate places, et cetera

et cetera

et cetera

et cetera

et cetera.

For the first time I can recall, everything fits in place like one of those incredibly complex 3D puzzles that just brings an astounding sense of accomplishment once completed. I have spent nineteen years assembling and I can truly begin to see the picture now.

I always dreamed but never knew it was this beautiful.

... And, you know, it dawned on me today that I never would have dared to imagine that working in one little restaurant as a hostess would be such a catalyst in my life and lead me to the people who could help me see the light. Yes, that light. No, not the death light. No tunnel.

Only ... a great expanse.

... Teehee. I am such an optimistic fool but this talk ain't empty. I promise.

So I've been working pretty damn often as of late and as tomorrow (or rather today technically) brings my only day off this week after many nights of busting headwait out, I realize that this lots-o'-work thing isn't bothering me so much recently. This makes me happy. In fact, a great abundance of things have been rolling off me like water drops and I'm content to leave them behind. For instance, Meme will be making the move on Saturday and I therefore need to have all of my things packed up and stationed out of the way before she gets there. So I spent a couple hours here and there sorting through my lifelong collection of belongings (because I am quite the notorious pack rat). Tomorrow, I plan on completing the task. But I digress. My point is that even as I stumbled across a myriad of mementos that before would have meant a stab of pain, this time ... well, this time, it was as easy as setting aside an old pair of underwear. Kind of comfy, kind of ugly now, but you know ... you had your moments with them. You just have to face the facts: they're aren't of any use to you anymore. Like my analogy? I did. Anyhow. I kept a couple things for posterity, like the Lilo & Stitch coloring book from Brian with the crumpled and satirical "I Love You" coloring job he did on one of the pages. I found a copy of Page 573 folded and placed in between pages as well, which made me smile in an, "Oh yeah" sort of way. I set aside the pictures that Sammy gave me, framed from my sophomore prom when I was with Jack. Things like that. These will be put aside so as not to lose that past entirely. However, they won't be very prevalent in my life anymore. They aren't my life anymore. In fact, nothing much remains of high-school at all ... and I'm fine with this, if only because I've done my mourning (and god knows I've done my mourning). Now it's time to move on. Josh is moving on. Jessi, Krissy, Taylor, Rebecca, Jacqueline, et cetera. These are the people I want to be with now. These are the people that want to be with me now. There is such a difference between them and a world such as Pine View that dominated me so easily. I have never been so immediately comfortable with someone as I am with Josh. I have never been so sure of my security with someone as I am with Josh. I have never been so readily able to toss all doubts to the wind as I am with Josh. It's been over two months and we haven't even told each other that we love one another yet. Now this may seem contradictory to what I'm saying but ... it isn't. In fact, it only strengthens my confidence. He doesn't have to say anything. I just ... know these things. Oh, hush, Lyndsay. I have no more motivation to write. What I want now is to change into warm, snuggly pajamas and crawl in bed with Josh. He has to keep me warm. It's pretty much due to me since he keeps his room like the damned icebox. Heh. I wouldn't have it any other way though.

Despite the fact that I rang in the new year at Outback, sitting in an office, typing away on a computer while my boyfriend and a couple other friends counted down over the PHONE ... it was altogether a decent night. Not one of the best nights I've ever had but definitely not the worst. I guess I can't be too disappointed. What else should I expect for being paid as much as I am at the tender age of nineteen?

Things improved today remarkably as Josh and I spent the entire day out and about the town, having lunch together and spending the majority of our time shopping with holiday gift certificates, et cetera. We've still got Best Buy shopping to do on top of that. And he's currently finishing up a gourmet dinner that he has spent about five hours in the kitchen preparing. ... It should be scrumptious indeed.

I've spent a good portion of this night browsing the computer components I want and purchasing those that I feel comfortable enough with while sipping on well poured Parrot Bay and Sprites. I'm six drinks down with plenty to go before dinner is even finished. Huzzah. Anyhow, computer! My case, cathode light and motherboard should be on their way very soon. I've simply to consult Kevin on my final decision for a processor and then we'll continue with the entire process. It will be beautiful ... with a beautiful bloo light.

... I'm happy.

Mm, time to check on dinner and get things rollin'.

First of all: if anyone received a phone call from me within the past 72 hours, it was not me. In fact, my service has been temporarily canceled due to the fact that Hollywood 20 decided to just randomly hand my phone out to a "young, Hispanic male" without any proof that he was the real owner after I called and spoke with them twice, including the manager on duty, informing them when I would be there to pick it up (and it was not to be on the same day). Ha! So after the dumb fuck was stupid enough to call the house twice (drawing Josh's wrath), a 'harassing phone call' report was made and consequently a case number issued involving the theft of my phone. Thank you, Officer Worthington. The Sheriffs' office should have obtained the video tape of the phone being given to this "young, Hispanic male" who has come to be known as 'Michael' to us (because that's how he answered my phone) and all I can hope to do at this point is perhaps coerce Hollywood 20 into paying for a new phone, since they are quite liable at this point. Especially since, if worse comes to worse, I will be forced to pay all fees for 'breaking contract' with T-Mobile if I have not received my phone back or bought a new phone to replace it by January 28th. So no cell phone for a while, bloody immature bastard. Josh and Jessi left about a half an hour ago to go do their Christmas at their father's house. I'm wide awake because a spastic kitten decided to rile up Aden, resulting in Aden chomping on her head for awhile. It's kind of hard to sleep through the yowls and whines of hyperactive animals when they're in the same room as you. Nevertheless, I feel quite fine and I think it's actually somewhat attributable to my new Zen alarm clock, which is muy wonderfulo. I suggest it to everyone if you have excessive sums of money laying about ... and who doesn't? So! I think I shall go shower myself, get dressed and piddle about town for a while until it's time for work. Fun, non? Yes.

I didn't have a chance to see Josh before I had to go to work. However, he called while I was in the midst of running an hour wait on board and asked if I wouldn't mind mayhaps having dinner with him when I was through. Of course, I was all for this. However, I didn't know when I would be cut. So around 8:30 PM, he started the walk to Outback from the house. Come 9:00 PM, when I was finally cut at work, I talked to Jessi for a little while before going outside around 9:15 PM to wait for him. It was odd that it should take him some 45 minutes to walk from the house to Outback but I figured he had just taken some extra time before leaving or mayhaps he was just being leisurely. Within a couple of minutes, I saw him approaching from a distance with what I assumed to be a book in his hands. Yet the closer he got, the more oddly shaped the book seemed to be ... until I realized as he waved at me that it was a rose wrapped up.

... Swoon.

We ate dinner together until I had to go back on board to close the restaurant. All part of sending Brin home. Ha. Then when I was done for a second time, I found him in Wal-Mart where he was purchasing his present for Jessi.

He missed me a lot. He voiced as much repeatedly. I missed him a whole lot too. ... Sigh. It's almost ridiculously delightful to have him back.

Oh well. I can live with that!

And, yay, we both work together tonight!

JOSH IS COMING HOME TODAY!

I must clean for him! I must!

And, oh, I can see so clearly being able to throw my arms around him and literally jumping on him.

I ... win?
Congratulations! You're Elrond!

Josh called from Tallahassee last night while I was in the midst of my wrapping spree. We chatted for some time until Taylor and Krissy came home, at which point the conversation digressed into his good-byes and my teasing, violent, "FINE, BYE!"s in return ... until he said the most sincere and yet off-handed 'I miss you' I have ever heard and I couldn't help but utter a cliche, "Aw, I miss you too!" before hanging up.

I had a nightmare last night involving a lady ghost, her death, Josh's death and the final test of my affections involving his ghost, a pair of scissors, stabbing Josh in the back with them ... and I couldn't do it. Even with the menacing threat of a supernatural death hovering behind me, even with the knowledge that this was not truly Josh before me but only his apparition, I couldn't do it.

I woke up crying.

God, I miss him and it's only been two days. I'm pathetic.

Sigh. I don't want Josh to leeeeeave for Tallahassee. I don't want Josh to be gone for a couple of days. I'm going to cry! ... Probably because I'm PMSing, but I'll cry nevertheless.

Josh is the one to make me smile right now! Every morning that I wake up with cramps and a backache, Josh is the one to sit at the foot of his bed, tapping away at his keyboard with his big, goofy headphones on (so as not to wake me). Then he looks at me, grins and says, "Good morning!" and I grunt a reply and roll over. He's the one to plant a kiss on me. He's the one to tickle my feet and piss me off because I'm grumpy anyhow ... and then I burrow under the covers and smile.

He won't let me get out of the car if it's cold outside. He inflated my tires for me, leaving me bundled up in my car with the heater on and a blanket wrapped around me.

If I mention I'm hungry, he'll immediately ask me what I want and prepare it for me.

If I'm moody, he'll do everything in his power to cheer me up ... and it usually works.

And even if I'm having the worst night at work, just seeing him in that kitchen makes me beam a smile.

He's ... so immeasurably wonderful that I almost feel as though I'm going to explode trying to put him in definable terms.

... If only he wouldn't keep his bedroom so damned cold though!

I bought him the Happy Tree Friends DVDs. He was giddy ... to watch cute animals slaughter each other in various ways over and over and over ... Mm, graphic carnage fun.

Secret Santa when Jessi and Josh and Taylor are back from Tally. I've already bought my Secret Santa present however I also want to get something for Jessi. I'll have to leave it anonymously on her bed though since the whole point of this Secret Santa deal was to avoid the guilt of not being able to purchase presents for everyone in the house. HA! Take that, Jessi! PRESENT FOR YOU. ... Since I already bought one for Krissy and Josh anyhow ...

The Christmas party was last night at Tulie's. Oh, it was a blast. Lots of karaoke, mingling, and scratch-off tickets. Jessi and I sang The Sign by Ace of Base (hell yeah) and Doug, Chris and I rocked-the-fuck out of Lump. Granted, that was after two shots of tequila, a vodka and cranberry and my mostest favoritest: Parrot Bay and Sprite. But, yes, we still rocked-the-fuck out of it. Doug won the scratch-off tree and so I helped him with a shitload of Bingo tickets. To show his gratitude, he let me keep a three-dollah winnah. Uh huh, uh huh.

See, now I'm just babbling. I want to see Josh again before he leaves but they left a while ago to say good-bye to their father before getting on the road with the promise that they'd be back soon ... and they are not back yet ... and I have to start getting ready for work soon! Sigh!

Oh well. I'll find a way.

... I don't want him to goooooo.
"I loved when Mac would sunburn so I could peel her. Yep." -- Krissy

So anyhow. Waterballoons, sheet, net, over the net, splash, fun. Mm, Josh threw Jessi and I in the pool and then snatched away all semblance of victory we could have managed by then jumping in the pool himself, thereby stealing our chance to push him. It was cold. He dumped a bucket of ice water on me immediately thereafter. It was colder. While on the phone with Meme to wish her a happy birthday as well, Josh ushered me inside where a quaint little birthday cake was waiting. Josh's immediate and in-law family members then serenaded me with a beautiful and totally impersonal version of Happy Birthday. It was touching. When goaded about who had the idea to purchase me a little birthday cake, Josh confessed that it was Tom. ... It made me cry, I was so appreciative. Mm, Josh, Jessi and I saw Love Actually. ... That too made me cry. I received a birthday card from Jessi and a birthday card from the dynamic duo of Krissy and Taylor. Upon arriving home from the movie theater, there were suddenly presents propped up on one of the bar stools beneath my newly restrung birthday banner. Taylor bought me a Care Bear Prayer Bear (or something of the sort). He made a point of mentioning that it was funny due to my religious tendencies. Silly boy. Jessi and Krissy gave me a box wrapped in PINK wrapping paper (curse them) and then two layers of packing tape which took me nearly twenty minutes to finally strip off only to discover a piece of paper within the box which said they were taking me on a $100 shopping spree (which will be this Thursday on our day off). ... Le sigh. I cried again. A lot more. ... Part of that was in the poorly lit hallway to Josh's room where the others couldn't see me as I quietly whispered how blessed I was to have all of them and Josh simply held me. ... Le sigh. I was supposed to be taking a three day vacation to Tallahasse on the 5th, 6th, and 7th (Friday thru Sunday), however Tom has issued a mandatory meeting that neither Jessi nor I can get out of. So now I have to call Bob and inform him that my visit is going to have to wait another month until Josh's drill weekend in January. Hopefully, this will not be an inconvenience. Oh, but let me just tell you: I was royally pissed when I discovered that Jessi and I couldn't go up to Tallahassee. We had requested the weekend off and everything. ... Le sigh! Nevertheless, Thursday will be said shopping spree with Jessi and Krissy. Then Jessi and I will escort Josh to Tampa where JR will then take him off our hands and up to Tallahasee. Jessi and I will then treat ourselves to a showing of Gothika, which I wanted to see on my birthday but which Josh did not want to see. Huzzah. Ooh, and Josh M. and Carmen bought me some purty lingerie (which I paraded around the house over my clothes, declaring, "JOSH! THEY BOUGHT US BOTH A BIRTHDAY PRESENT!") as a joke and then this very cool game called Scene It? which is simply a blast. ... Oh, and a can of silly string to the face but that was sort of a one-time thing. ... Bastards. ::grins:: My mommy bought me this gorgeous leather jacket (that I discovered ran her a couple hundred). I am happy. I invited everyone to Livingston's on Friday. Josh and I played pool for a while, then Taylor showed, then Jessi and Krissy. I had all food and drinks put on the table tab (with devious intentions of paying it all myself at the end of the night as a treat for us all). So some six shots, five mixed drinks, and innumerable beers later, by the time there were closing at 2:00 AM, we had run up at $113.00 and some odd change tab. I scurried up to the counter and managed to pay it off before anyone noticed. I was elated to be able to treat everyone. Elated that we were all out together for one night. ... Also elated that the cocktail waitress decided not to card any of us. ... But I've noticed that this is the benefit to being with a group of people who are 24, 24, 24, and 21. ... I sure as hell don't think I look 21 but ... whatever! If you think I do... Which was made even more amusing by the fact that they had my ID up at the counter. Haha. Oh, good times. Good Parrot Bay and Sprite times later ... Let's see. What else? Oh yes. There is talk of Taylor and Krissy moving out and having their own place by February 1st. As such, there has been discussion as to who would be taking their place in the house. The immediate thought is me, of course, but then questions arise about whether or not this would be a good idea since Josh and I are now dating. Well, I discussed this with Josh today over dinner and despite a couple taboo apprehensions, we're both confident that it would be feasible since we'd have separate rooms. Any and all problems we discussed were easily surmountable in the scheme of things. ... So within a couple months, I might be relocated into my happy commune. Huzzah times TWO. But enough for now. I want to go curl up with Josh and fall asleep. I've had a long, drawn out day off and now it is time to slumber.

What a great couple of days. This has easily been the best birthday I've had in a couple of years and that is entirely due to my boyfriend, my close friends and my other immediate surrounding companions.

Josh nixed breakfast Thanksgiving morning for a couple of reasons, all of which were in my own interest. (A) I hadn't gone to sleep until 6:00 AM and he wanted to let me sleep in. (B) We would be eating at 1:00 PM anyhow and he wanted me to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner without being stuffed already. That was all well and good and I know he'd be willing to cook breakfast for me nearly any time I should ask (bless his heart), so I took it in stride.

I woke up sometime around 11:30 AM with the impression that we had to be over at Tom's house ASAP (which we did). Nevertheless, we were fashionably late but still on time for dinner to be served at 1:00 PM. There was a buffet set up in the dining room with the sliders leading to the patio open. A long white table was set up next to the pool with fall-themed table centers and all the table fixin's. It was very lovely.

After dinner, people relaxed for a while, milling about here and there. I helped Josh fill up the waterballoons for the muchly anticipated waterballoon volleyball and then the fun could begin. ... Waterballoon volleyball is a BLAST. The net was set up as usual but instead of a volleyball, there are two teams of four equipped with a sheet. Everyone grabs a corner, slides the intimidatingly large waterballoon onto the center and then heaves it over the net .......





...........


I'll finish this later. Josh is awake and ... yeah.

For the simple sake of entertainment, let me share what I have written on my birthday for the past two years. I was perusing old entries and thought to check those 'special days' that I had logged. Mm, heh. I almost feel removed from these things, as though I were reading something entirely fictional. Then again, my memory serves me 'well' enough that everything is painted perfectly. ... I simply hope that today outshines the others. ... And happy birthday to Pavement too, my beautiful big yellow cat. Cheers to another Thanksgiving baby. November 26th of 2001: " . . . For now, we'll just concentrate on me and ignore those other factors that can get under my skin. For now, we take a deep breath (though we're not all that flustered) and realize that tomorrow is my seventeenth birthday, another step toward what is considered lawful womanhood - as if that really means much at all. Seventeen years old and thatmuch closer to graduation and a new life, a new life that Jack can't seem to get a grasp on yet... He's still dwelling on the ruins of his friendships from high school and, quite honestly, I both pity and detest him for it at the same time. I couldn't, of course, truly despise him in real sense but I get so agitated when he starts on a spiel about how all of his friends have stabbed him in the back. He seems to think that he's the only to have ever been subjected to such a situation. And, oh, I love him to death, but he drives me to tears every time when I try and convince him otherwise or when I try and justify anything to make him feel the least bit better. It's like kicking a damned dead horse! So what am I supposed to do? Nod and say, "You're right, Jack. Everyone hates/hated you,"? NO!" We were on our way to his mothers Sunday afternoon, to have a little social time with her so he could get caught up since he hadn't seen her in a while. While driving, he began on that tangent again and when I tried to counter his arguments, we somehow wound up on the topic of changing one's self. I believe it had something to do with how he had been getting better (because when asked by me what I had ever changed about him, he stated that I helped him appreciate his friends more) but had been relapsing into that angry, bitter state of thinking recently. He was adamant that it was too hard to changes one's self and I responded by saying that I knew just as well as he did how hard it was. In fact, he was the one that encouraged me to changes the things about me that I didn't like: the mind games, the neverending cycle of depression, the too-thick walls built against people... So here we are in the car, "arguing" over this when he says something to the effect of it being impossible for someone to change themselves after all. And, oh my, the tears that he triggered with that statement - because he had been the one to give me the courage to attempt such a feat and he had been the one that held me everytime I broke down and urged me to keep going and now he was the one telling me that it would never actually work and I was the one left with hollow words from the man I love. It's understandable that I was so upset, correct? Well, before we could get to his mother's house, he pulled into a small dirt parking lot next to a park of some sort in order to right things. He convinced me that what he had said just a few minutes ago was nothing more than words said out of anger, bitterness, simple strength of emotion. Yes, convinced me. Convinced me easily because I can't bear to think that everything I've been striving for within myself was founded upon those devastatingly hollow words from the man I love. They can't be hollow or else I'm left to believe that I'm forever the manipulative, emotionless, walled-off girl that I have been in the past. I know that can't be the case because Jack broke through those walls and I broke through his - so it has to be possible for people to change, right? ...Right... Enough of this. Too many good things on the way to get weighed down by heavy emotions. ...Good things... - Lyndsay" ... I remember that incident so clearly too. I had been entertaining myself with a color-by-number picture in the Monsters Inc. coloring book he had bought me. You want to know something funny? At some point in the deterioration of my relationship with Jack, he cited my 'immaturity' as a flaw that drove him away, including specifically my penchant for such activities as coloring. ... Now why, pray tell, if this was such a bother to him did he seem so delighted to buy me coloring books? ... Huh. Hehe. Let's see. What else? Post-birthday perhaps? ... Oh, yes, oh. ::dies of laughter:: Yeah, this is good. November 29th of 2001: " . . . For those of you not familiar with my crude Latin, that translates into: I am filth. Can you tell how good of a mood I'm in? Oh yes, I'm just bursting with positive energy. ...Actually, no. I feel like absolute crap and I'm angry at the world and I'm having a horrible day, as though someone out there wanted to top off my absolutely horrible day and night from yesterday. Thank you, whoever you are, for deciding that my life is one worth systematically destroying. It's not like the fact that my mother is my only parent and we don't get along affects me in any way. Of course not. But that's mostly my mother's fault. So maybe she's the one intent upon destroying me. She certainly doesn't listen when I try and push her for another appointment with the psychiatrist. I'm sorry, this isn't going to be organized in any sense of the word. This will actually be quite the opposite. I'm angry. I'm venting. I'm annoyed. I'm so damn alone because I can't even turn to Jack anymore. I tried. I came home from school, I called him. I vented... He... couldn't cheer me up. Well, didn't seem to me like he made much of an effort in the first place. He tells me now that it's because it gets harder and harder every time. Even if he made an effort, however, I would still feel better than when I hang up with him after that - because then I just feel worse, 'cause (guess what) I feel like I'm losing my boyfriend. I quote: "how should i feel though... every day, something horrible happens to you, do you know how much energy it takes to cheer someone up... it is really hard... and every day I go through the same things... i know it's hard, but I can only help so much" With my luck, he'll read this and get upset with me for posting what he said. At this point, I don't care anymore. I'm angry with everyone. Everyone! Well, maybe not Sam... or Jay... or the people who truly make a sit-down effort to cheer me up when they know I'm upset. People who still try. Thank you to them. But yes, I am royally pissed off (and wounded, but we'll ignore that for now because the anger carries more fuel with it) at the fact that Jack can't even muster the energy to make an effort toward me anymore. "it just seems like i am not doing anything since every time you revert to being unhappy again... i don't know how to make you feel better, i want to so badly... i just wish i could wipe away your troubles" So he doesn't even try anymore. I get silence on the phone instead. I hang up with him feeling worse than I did when I first called. That's not good. Bad thoughts have started to creep inside my mind. Like 'break up' thoughts, though I would never propose the idea. I know he wouldn't right now either... but maybe he's having the same thoughts. [Please make note that we broke up very, very shortly hereafter. Say, within a week or so?] And the only way I would find out was to bring it up, but I don't want to put him into a panic. I just want to know where we stand right now because if breaking up is a remote possibility in my mind, then something is not right. He's just so far away (and NO! I don't mean the distance!)... Grrrrrrrrrrr. GRRRRRRRRRRr. GRrrrrrrrrrr... If I were a man, I'd be slamming my fist into a wall right now. Since I'm female (and me), I'm going to growl instead. Right. Way to go, Lyndsay. . . . What the hell am I doing wrong? I love Jack. But why does it feel like I'm losing him steadily? I would ignore everything else - my mother, school, everything... only if I could repair things with Jack. Funny how he's still my number one priority. . . ." Attached to this entry were the notes: 'Note to self: Remind Jack that you damned well do know how much energy it takes to cheer someone up since he's not exactly Mr. Sunshine all the time either. Perhaps he forgot that. It would be best to refresh his memory. Love, Yourself' followed by 'I did forget it... umm... ... ... ... all my love, -jack' ::giggles:: LET US CONTINUE TO 2002!!!!! November 27th of 2002: "8:00 AM on this Wednesday morning, my birthday, and I am crying. I have no reason to be crying really. I mean, on one hand, the realization that I'm going to be spending half of my birthday alone in this house is kind of depressing but ... it's not all that unlike any other day, right? Brian and Josh have left to take Robin to work and then continue on their way to help Brian's father close down the shop, a half day of work. Brian should have been leaving for Ohio today but that fell through last night - the trip he was looking forward to so much has now been cancelled. He said the other day that he almost wouldn't mind simply because he had been planning on taking a roadtrip up to Ohio when he had the money anyhow but he also said last night that all twenty-something of his cousins would be there which is a rare occurance and he would have liked to see them. I don't blame him - when you have an actual family, it's nice to spend time with them if given the opportunity. In the meantime, now he won't have the anxiety over my allegiance to him while he's out of town. He's not going anywhere and neither am I. My home is still within him. And I get my boyfriend for part of my birthday. I think I'll get to see Megan, Brinson, Paul and Shane tonight too to see Harry Potter. To see Brinson and Paul will be a nice treat. A very nice treat. So what is this nauseating depression that hangs over me? As I said before, I have no reason to feel this way. To be totally honest, it seems things are looking up on every front imaginable for the time being... I mean, I've found some place to live. The car will be signed over to me shortly. Brian is back to his old self to some degree. My job is pretty much as enjoyable as it has always been (if one ignores the incapacitating cramps I've been suffering the past two days). Brian and Robin made me cry the other day with their birthday presents to me. They brought out a pumpkin pie with an 18 candle in it. I don't think I could even begin to express how much that meant to me. Brian wrote me a love-letter (::drool::), gave me two coloring books and a new box of crayons and a bottle of the perfume I've borrowed from my mother too many times to count. He was proud that he took notice when I perused the aisles for it at Wal-Mart one time. I was too. Robin bought me some beautiful clothes that Brian helped her select and an absolutely beautiful locket that matched. The ring Brian gave me the other day as an early birthday present (simply because I ... had been persistently begging him in a way and he was impatient to give me something) is just as beautiful - it's the perfect style of ring too.
